content: What are opinions on the best way to represent something like RECIST data in a set of FHIR resources? (typically referred to as "response data")
Base information can be tracked via the Condition resource with specific data included in Observations and DiagnosticReports

So you're thinking that it's a combination of these resources linked together that would form the whole picture of a tumor's response overall? It would be great to see a fake example, I can try to mock one up...do you know of any out there in the wild?

Yeah, you're not going to have a single resource that can capture the wide array of information that is needed for a response. I'm not aware of a full example, but if you can create one, lots of people would love you for it.
@Lloyd McKenzie , any input as one of the resident FHIR gurus? Or @Hugh Glover ?
what's RECIST data? (I admit this grabbed my attention because I misread the title when scanning topics)
thanks. well, i think that we'd agree with @David Pyke
They need to work on a better acronym
@May Terry may know if mCODE has done any work in this space
Agreed that the acronym could use some work....thanks to all the responses!
